title: 115_hr5206
content: The Office of Biometric Identity Management Authorization Act of 2018 establishes the Office of Biometric Identity Management under the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Office of Biometric Identity Management is established within the Department's Management Directorate. It will be administered by a Director with experience in biometrics and identity management to support various security services. The Office of Biometric Identity Management within the Department supports border security, credentialing, national security, and public safety by analyzing biometric data and sharing it with various government agencies and private sector entities to enhance operational missions. The Office of Biometric Identity Management supports border security, national security, and public safety by managing biometric repositories, providing analysis services, overseeing biometric standards, and coordinating with other agencies. The Office of Biometric Identity Management enters data sharing agreements with various agencies to support immigration, law enforcement, national security, and public safety missions, ensures interoperability with other biometric systems, and complies with privacy policies and procedures. It also consults with the Office for Civil Rights. The Office of Biometric Identity Management consults with the Office for Civil Rights regarding biometric technologies and disparities based on race or ethnicity. A Deputy Director assists the Director in managing the office, and the Director may establish other necessary offices within the organization. The Director must notify specific congressional committees 30 days before exercising certain authority. A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents in the Homeland Security Act of 2002. The Office of Biometric Identity Management is established under Sec. 710.
